definition: lit. as different as sky and earth (idiom)/fig. night and day difference/opposite extremes/a world of difference/a far cry from
day/sky/heaven
soil/earth
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

sentences.english: Ice caves are very different from normal caves.
sentences.chinese: 冰洞窟与普通的洞窟有着天壤之别。

sentences.english: It is a world away from the world we know.
sentences.chinese: 这是与我们熟知的世界有着天壤之别的世界。

sentences.english: In architecture, there's a big difference between a sketch and a plan.
sentences.chinese: 在建筑学里，草图和设计图有着天壤之别。

sentences.english: Red, for example, is often associated with strawberry but also with chilli.
sentences.chinese: 草莓和辣椒同为红色，但口味却有天壤之别。

sentences.english: It's a far cry from Twilight Princess' uncomfortably shoehorned waggling.
sentences.chinese: 这和黄昏公主那种硬塞进去的体感操作有着天壤之别。

sentences.english: But the accommodations provided are worlds apart.
sentences.chinese: 但是这两个地方提供的住宿服务却是有着天壤之别。

sentences.english: Contrast that with today's political science.
sentences.chinese: 与今日的政治科学有着天壤之别。

sentences.english: Put side-by-side with future fourth-generation plants, the difference is night and day.
sentences.chinese: 它与未来的第四代核电站有天壤之别。

sentences.english: The inns of the past were certainly different from the deluxe hotels all over the world today.
sentences.chinese: 以前的小酒店与今日遍布全球的豪华饭店有天壤之别。

definition: a complete contrast/totally different
poles apart (idiom)/entirely different
as different as heaven and earth (idiom)/worlds apart
lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: bu4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3

definition: not at all the same/substantially different
as different as can be (idiom)/poles apart
entirely different/different as black and white
huge difference
widely different/utterly different
different tunes played with equal skill (idiom)/different methods leading to the same result/different approach but equally satisfactory outcome
lit. minor magician in the presence of a great one (idiom)/fig. to pale into insignificance by comparison
not much difference
equally matched/about the same
lit. to speak of two things on the same day (idiom); to mention things on equal terms (often with negatives: you can't mention X at the same time as Y)
nothing other than/to differ in no way from/the same as/to amount to
to differ/discrepancy between
